basics.name: Austin Meadows
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: I am a scientist with a decade of experience working in the New York research community seeking a role focused on research, data science, and technological development. Please see my website for more details about my projects and publications

work.name: Instituto de Salud Carlos III
work.summary: Pathology of trained immunity (TI) in the lab of Dr. Jordi Ochando
highlights: characterize and therapeutically target TI in chronic kidney disease
Developed first ex-vivo model of dialysis-mediated TI + first clinical TI diagnostic

work.name: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
work.summary: Genomics subject matter expert supporting academic research
highlights: Developed epigenetic treatment strategy for melanoma
Developed nanoparticle biologic for lung transplant rejection
preliminary data used to secure $4.4M in NIH awards

work.name: Girihlet, Inc.
work.summary: Provided next-gen sequencing (NGS) services to NYC research community
highlights: Tailored NGS solutions for clients from consultation to data generation
Automated our workflow with a custom software framework and custom robotics

work.name: NYIT College of Osteopathic Medicine
work.summary: Supported research efforts of the NYITCOM dept. of Biomedical Sciences
highlights: Created ML tool for cell deconvolution in tumor sequencing data
Created a neuroscience teaching resource for medical students
Prepared historically underrepresented students for higher education as coordinator of the STEP program

work.name: Stony Brook University
work.summary: Multiomics research in the lab of Dr. Eric Brouzes
highlights: Created a microscope climate chamber for long-duration imaging experiments of sensitive cells
Created an automated yeast culture device

publications.name: WNTinib is a multi-kinase inhibitor with specificity against beta-catenin mutant hepatocellular carcinoma
publications.summary: WNTinib, a selective multi-kinase inhibitor, effectively targets CTNNB1-mutant hepatocellular carcinoma by inhibiting KIT/MAPK signaling and engaging EZH2-mediated transcriptional repression, offering a potent and durable therapy with high specificity and safety.

publications.name: Click chemistry approaches to expand the repertoire of PEG-based fluorinated surfactants for droplet microfluidics
publications.summary: We developed a simplified, click chemistry-based synthesis of novel fluorinated PFPE–PEG surfactants that stabilize droplets in microfluidics, enabling easier production of diverse, biocompatible emulsions.

publications.name: The T cell receptor repertoire reflects the dynamics of the immune response to vaccination
publications.summary: Tseek, a novel TCR repertoire sequencing method, enables early, detailed, and non-invasive profiling of individual T cell responses to vaccines, revealing unique immune dynamics and potential for personalized immune monitoring.

publications.name: Active Learning Exercises in Synaptic Physiology and Connectivity for the Neuroscience Lecture Hall, Laboratory Course, or Outreach Setting
publications.summary: We present novel active learning exercises for teaching neuronal circuits and synaptic connectivity in lecture-based neuroscience courses to enhance student understanding and retention.

publications.name: H2A.Z chaperones converge on E2F target genes for melanoma cell proliferation
publications.summary: H2A.Z chaperone complexes SRCAP and P400–TIP60 coordinate H2A.Z deposition and H4 acetylation to promote melanoma proliferation, with YL1 overexpression linked to poor prognosis and apoptosis upon its loss, highlighting them as potential therapeutic targets.

publications.name: Community assessment of methods to deconvolve cellular composition from bulk gene expression
publications.summary: A community-wide DREAM Challenge benchmarking deconvolution methods reveals that while many accurately infer immune cell infiltration in tumors, deep learning approaches improve detection of functional T cell states, providing valuable resources for method development.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
